Main_Headline: Your mind and body are connected
Body_Quote: Movember UK says: 'Seeking support is a sign of strength, not weakness. We work towards a world where men will take action to improve their mental health before reaching breaking point.'
Call_To_Action: Move this Movember - Care for your whole self

Body_Quote: Movember's 'Move for Mental Health' campaign: 'Run or walk 60km over November.' Find exercise that brings you joy: dance, football, gym, yoga, walking.
Balanced nutrition supports mental health, energy, and immunity. Nourish yourself well.
Quality sleep affects everything: mood, immunity, heart health, weight. Aim for 7-9 hours.
Substance use doesn't define you. Support is available. You deserve healing.
Black Minds Matter UK: 'We connect Black individuals with free therapy (up to 10 sessions) delivered by qualified Black therapists.'
Movember UK statistics: '3 out of 4 UK suicides are by men. More than 13 men take their own lives every day.' Depression often shows as anger or irritability.
Living while Black and queer comes with daily anxiety. Breathing exercises, grounding, therapy, medication - all valid tools.
Movember UK: 'Suicide is the biggest killer of men under 50.' Samaritans approach: 'ASK, LISTEN, ENCOURAGE ACTION and CHECK IN'
Movember UK research: '64% of men wait more than a week with symptoms before seeing a doctor. 31% wait over a month.' Asking for help is courage.
Racism, homophobia, transphobia cause trauma. PTSD is real. Trauma-informed therapy helps heal. You deserve to process pain.
Loneliness harms physical health. Community connection is healthcare. Reach out.
Persistent anger can signal depression or trauma. It's okay to feel angry. It's important to process it healthily.
ADHD, autism, dyslexia are underdiagnosed in Black men. Diagnosis opens doors to support.
UK winters are dark. SAD affects mood, energy, sleep. Light therapy, vitamin D, therapy help.
Consent is ongoing, enthusiastic, and can be withdrawn anytime. Communication is sexy. Respect is essential.
MPOX vaccine available free on NHS for eligible people. Protect yourself and community.
Chemsex carries risks. Harm reduction: hydration, dosage awareness, never alone, naloxone access.
Healthy relationships require: communication, boundaries, respect, autonomy, trust. Abuse happens in queer relationships too.
Terrence Higgins Trust campaign: 'Can't Pass It On - People on HIV treatment cannot pass it on during sex.' Test - Treat - Protect.
Your body deserves pleasure exactly as it is. Diet culture, fatphobia, and racism harm intimacy.
Ethical non-monogamy requires communication, boundaries, honesty. There's no one right way to love.
ED, premature ejaculation, low libido - all common, all treatable. Talk to your GP or sexual health clinic.
MEN R US (menrus.co.uk): 'An approachable and comprehensive directory to gay men's health.' Sex education failed queer people. Knowledge is power and pleasure.
